Observe the buyer's initial choice and set the prices in Stage 2 to slightly favor the chosen item. For example, if the buyer chooses the apple, set the apple price to 4 and the orange price to 6. This increases the likelihood of the buyer sticking with their initial choice, maximizing your utility by receiving a higher price for the chosen item in Stage 3.
